<section id='content'>. Used as a unique identifier for an element - must be unique within the same document.

<l class="l_class" layout="relevant" >The layout attribute by default is 'irrelevant' - meaning no white space preserving basically. The 'relevant' attribute value when specified, allows the user agent to preserve white space.
The words used by the W3C - 'allows the user agent...' assumes that the user agent being
used at the time will preserve white space if capable. The 'pre' element overrides the layout setting if set
The title attribute defines meta-information about the element on which it is set. Useful for hyperlink information.
More information on this at w3.org's site.
